result.execSummary:
The defendant Cristofer J Steinfeldt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person/Corpse [Modifiers: Penalty - Theft if Taken/Person/Corpse], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all prison wages at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant shall obtain and maintain full time employment or schooling or combination thereof to equal full time.

Defendant shall work on completing HSED/GED.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substance without a valid prescription and then take medication as prescribed.

Defendant shall have no contact with J.L.M., her children or her residence.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with recommendations.

Defendant shall pay any supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

Defendant shall submit to random drug and alcohol screens.

Defendant shall complete a mental health assessment if requested and cooperate with recommendations and programming.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Sentencing hearing on April 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Catherine Jane Terry.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper for State.  Clerk: EZ.  State moves to delete the Repeater enhancer in Count 1, Count 2, Count 3 and Count 4 and upon plea to Count 4 as amended recommend PSI and indicates both sides free to argue sentence and Count 1, Count 2 and Count 3 would be dismissed for read-in.  No contest plea entered to Count 4 as amended.  Court finds def guilty on Count 4 as amended,  Court dismissed Count 1, Count 2 and Count 3 for read-in.    Presentence Investigation Report ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Plea hearing on March 4, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Court does not accept the Alford plea.  Atty. Terry makes bail modification motion to $500.00 cash bond, State request cash bond as ordered remain.  Court denies bail modification.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Hearing on December 12, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Katherine Romonawich State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Jeanette Kara Corbett for State.    Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. SPD will represent Def; State requests significant cash bond due to the nature of the offense, the facts of the case and def having four prior convictions; Argument from defense; Court sets $2000.00 cash bail; Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for December 12, 2014 at 09:00 am.
